rating.source: Based on LinkedIn endorsements & peer reviews

bio.short: Founding Engineer and Software Professional (First Class Honours, USYD) who bridges the gap between complex backend logic and user-centric product delivery.
bio.full:
I am a Founding Engineer and Software Professional (First Class Honours, USYD) who bridges the gap between complex backend logic and user-centric product delivery. Currently, I am the Product Lead for Done. Life, an AI-first productivity platform, where I own the full lifecycle from architectural design to App Store deployment.

My technical foundation is built on shipping production-grade infrastructure‚Äîfrom acting as a 'force multiplier' at Accenture (automating security provisioning by 80%) to architecting novel AI pipelines that convert unstructured data into structured calendar events.

Beyond code, I possess a distinct leadership profile as the former President of the USYD Robotics Club, where I scaled the organisation to 1,800+ members. I excel at translating vague requirements into shipped software, whether navigating ambiguous client needs or defining 'Zero-to-One' product roadmaps.

coreThemes.title: Build-Run-Own Mindset
coreThemes.description: I don't just write code; I architect the solution, manage the cloud operations, and handle the compliance (from GDPR to App Store verification).

coreThemes.title: AI & Scalability
coreThemes.description: I build systems that handle complexity‚Äîfrom scaling database permissions at Accenture to designing 'Split-Path' AI engines that optimize cost and latency.

coreThemes.title: Clarity
coreThemes.description: I excel at translating technical trade-offs for non-technical stakeholders (clients, students, leadership).

trivia.fact: Can name every country in the world in under 10 minutes
Has FlightRadar24 permanently open for planespotting
Plays chess (rating is... a work in progress)
Scaled USYD Robotics Club from 230 to 1,800+ members
Once accidentally brought down a database at Accenture, then turned it into a security win
Managed a crisis when 1,100 people signed up for a 60-person event
